name: Lucas
text: [i]Today is my last day with Mom.[/i]

[i]Our living room is quiet.
More quiet than usual.
Mom turned off the TV to talk with me.[/i]

[i]She normally wouldn’t turn it off just to talk.
But today is different.
She produces a small plastic device from her pocket.[/i]

[i]I have seen it before. Many times.
It is her Tamagotchi. She’s had it for…
Well as long as I can remember.[/i]

name: Mom
text: I want to give something to you, Lucas.

name: Lucas
text: A present?

name: Mom
text: Yes, a present.

name: Lucas
text: [i]She opens my tiny hand and puts her Tamagotchi in it.[/i]

name: Mom
text: Isn't it cute?

name: Lucas
text: Yes Mom! It’s adorable.

name: Mom
text:
Hehe.
That it is.
And you know what?

It even helped me throughout my life.
It encouraged and supported me.
Can you believe that?

But you have to promise me one thing, honey.
You will have to look out for it. Care for it.

name: Mom
text: Can you do that for me, Lucas?

next.text: That’s the spirit!
I know you will, hon.

choices.text: I don't know if I can.

next.text: I’m sure you two will be fine. Just remember to feed it every now and then.

name: Mom
text:
This Tamagotchi means a lot to me.
And that’s exactly why I’m giving it to you.
I can’t really look after it when I’m at the bottom of the ocean.

name: Lucas
text:
Do you really have to go Mom?
To the bottom of the ocean? Isn’t that dangerous?

[i]Mom suddenly falls silent and looks out the window as if searching for something.
Her gaze returns to me and I see her smiling gently.[/i]

name: Mom
text: Yeah. I think that is my calling.
Well... and it also is my responsibility.
My team and I have been working day and night for this project, you know?
It would be like... letting your friends down after you promised them something.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]I look down in defeat.
My effort of convincing my mother to stay was - as always - fruitless.
Maybe she will listen to me when I’m older. For now I can only hope.[/i]

name: Mom
text:
Oh, don’t be sad. This is not the first time I have been gone for a few days, is it?
Your aunt will take care of you.
And this time you even have a little friend for emotional support.

name: Lucas
text: Do you mean the Squid?

name: Mom
text:
That’s right. It is a good friend. As long as you keep it alive of course.
I have had it for more years than I can count.
In many ways it is more reliable than a real friend…
But of course no substitute for one.
Now, as this day will be our last for a while, why don’t you go ahead and say where you want to go for dinner? We can go anywhere you want.

name: Lucas
text:
Anywhere?
Even Ryan's Burger Joint?

name: Mom
text: [i]sigh[/i]
Even Ryan's Burger Joint, yes.

name: Squid
text: I’m really hungry!
Oh, another one’s hungry?

name: Lucas
text: It talks?

name: Mom
text: Yes, occasionally. You know I wasn’t joking when I said the squid gave me advice and encouraged me.
Well to be fair it usually demands more than it gives, haha.

… Like now. It’s crying.
Good grief, it’s almost as needy as someone else I know.

name: Lucas
text: Mom! I’m not a baby anymore.

name: Mom
text: I’m just pulling your leg. You are much more mature than I was with ten you know?
But why don’t you use that chance to get a hang of the Tamagotchi?
Yeah just like that. Guess you are a natural. Now I have no qualms leaving you two alone for a bit.

But sometimes it will have other needs besides food. Like bathing. Playing.
You know, just like everyone else.
Except unlike everyone else it can’t take care of these things on its own.

name: Lucas
text: Leave them to me!

name: Squid
text: Let’s be friends!

name: Lucas
text: Whoa, did it just respond to me?

name: Mom
text:
Maybe. Hehe.
Sometimes I really think it has a mind of its own.
Well then… Let’s go to Ryan’s Burger Joint.

name: Lucas
text: Yeah!

name: Lucas
text:
[i]We enjoyed our dinner at Ryan’s Burger Joint. The best burger joint in town, at least I think so.
It’s little more than a rundown shack which happens to offer food.[/i]
[i]I don’t blame Mum for not being a big fan, but their salmon steak burgers are to die for.[/i]

[i]It’s my last day with Mom. Maybe for a long time.
She didn’t actually say for how long she will be gone.[/i]
[i]I will miss her.[/i]
[i]A week passed, which felt like a year or more.[/i]
[i]Every time someone rang our doorbell I rushed down from my room before my aunt could even rise from her chair.[/i]
[i]It always was the post or people my aunt chased away.[/i]

[i]Today is different though. Today my aunt let people in.
Scary looking people with grim faces.[/i]

[i]Not cute faces like my needy squid.
But maybe I shouldn’t compare people to my squid.[/i]
[i]The scary people with grim faces made my aunt cry and then they left.[/i]

name: Squid
text: Are you lonely? I am lonely.

name: Lucas
text:
So you want my attention, huh? You know, I think I understand you little one.
Yeah… Guess I’m lonely too. I hope Mum will be back soon.
[i]The squid was in constant need of playing and talked to me quite a bit but not once throughout this week it asked for food.[/i]
[i]Maybe our time at Ryan’s filled it up for good.[/i]

name: Aunt Mary
text: Can you come down for a bit Lucas?

name: Lucas
text:
My aunt's voice is hoarse and quieter than usual.
I walk down the stairs and I hear my aunt sobbing.
[i]I feel bad for not having been at her side when those guys came, but she sent me upstairs.[/i]

Did these men threaten you?
I think they were really scary.

name: Aunt Mary
text:
No… It was nothing like that Lucas.
Please, come sit with me here for a second.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]I can see her trying her hardest to hold back her tears.
Maybe she is embarrassed. I wish I could tell her that I don’t mind.[/i]

name: Aunt Mary
text: Chris- …

name: Lucas
text: [i]Her voice shakes and she takes a few seconds to collect herself.[/i]

name: Aunt Mary
text:
Your mother is missing.
They lost contact with her submarine a few days ago.
She- … they think she is dead.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]I heard what my aunt said but I can’t really make sense of them.
She must have seen my lost expression and explained it to me again.
And again.
And now I think I know what she means.[/i]
[i]Despite my aunt being there I feel like I’m alone.[/i]

[i]I don’t really remember what happened afterwards.
I must have cried.
My pillow is soaked…[/i]

name: Squid
text: Don’t be sad. Play with me!
… How do you know I’m sad?

Not about to respond to me, are you?
Mum said I wouldn’t be alone. That I had you.
But I still feel alone.

name: Squid
text: Are you lonely? I am lonely.
You really have a mind of your own, don’t you?

[i]I laugh but soon my laughing returns to sobbing.
But it feels less painful now.[/i]
[i]Maybe I’m not alone after all.[/i]
[i]Middle school was not really easy on me.[/i]

[i]Being the guy who wouldn’t shut up about the sea or how he wanted to explore it might have gotten a pass from my peers…
If it hadn’t been for my obsession with my digital pet Squid.[/i]
[i]But I couldn’t just ditch my Squid. It means too much to me.[/i]

[i]What young kids in elementary school found cool or interesting was very much a no-go in middle school.
And I learned that the hard way.[/i]

[i]I will do things differently in high school now.
Be the best version of myself.
And be a bit more subtle about my squid care.[/i]
[i]If I can manage.[/i]

name: squid
text: I’m sooo hungry.
[i]It will be difficult.[/i]
Is that a Tamagotchi you got there?

[i]In front of me stands a handsome boy approximately my age.
His longish brown hair slightly covers one side of his bespectacled face.
Whether that is intentional I have no idea.[/i]
[i]He seems like the kind of person who is good looking without even trying.[/i]
[i]But nevermind his looks.[/i]
[i]… I can’t believe that I could not even hide my obsession for one day.[/i]
Gotta play this cool.

next.text: Man, that’s crazy. I dig it.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: You… dig it?

Yeah, I had one too. Years back.
Fun thing. A dolphin if you can believe that.
It died.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Oh…

Yeah. Maybe that says something about me?
Well I guess they never last too long.
How old is yours?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
Ah. I don’t know.
I have had it for… six years?
But as far as I know it is even older than that.

Are you kidding me?
That’s crazy.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Crazy?

Absolutely crazy.
Yours looks young too. Is it one of these Tamagotchi that doesn’t age?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I-
So... you are taking care of the Tamagotchi of someone else?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Yeah, I guess.
You guess you take care of the Tamagotchi of someone else?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
Yeah. I... Uhh.
Well I guess you could call it my Tamagotchi after all.
You sure guess a lot of things.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I guess so, yeah.

[i]I really blew that.
So much for a fresh start.[/i]

…
I really hate to break it for you but no matter how you look at it, that is not a smartphone.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: [i]Ok, alright. The battle is not lost just yet.[/i]
It is an older model.

With no touchscreen and four buttons?
A two-colored display?
No cameras whatsoever?

Well but I already saw your Tamagotchi, so even if this is a phone, which I do not doubt, mind you...
Then it’s still at the very least a Tamagotchi App?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: That’s... right.

[i]That, ah, was not a stellar performance.
My school life won’t exactly be smooth sailing from here on.[/i]

text: Oh, sorry, I’m Michael by the way.

name: Lucas
text: I’m Lucas.

name: Michael
text: You are already leaving an impression on me, Lucas.

name: Lucas
text: And that is… a good thing?

name: Michael
text:
I would like to think so, yes.
You are different. I like different.

name: Lucas
text: I didn’t really want to be different.

name: Michael
text:
Only people who are different think that.
Once you are like everyone else you wish you were different.

name: Lucas
text: Is that how it works?

name: Michael
text:
Beats me, Lucas.
I said that because it sounded neat.
But can something sounding so neat be wrong?

next.text:
Yeah me too.
On the off chance you are wrong I still would like to write this down.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: You know, you are plenty “different” yourself, Michael.

[i]Michael stops smiling if only for a fraction of a second.
I wonder if I overstepped my bounds with this de facto stranger.
But then - seemingly out of nowhere - Michael bursts out in laughter.[/i]

next.name: Michael
next.text: Yeah, no kidding.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Well you say that, Lucas, but your eyes are telling a different story.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: My eyes are telling a story?

next.name: Michael
next.text: Well yes, but you gotta stop taking things literally.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I’m sorry, I usually don’t talk that much.

next.name: Michael
next.text:
Yeah, that was the kind of story your eyes were telling.
You need the confidence to actually say it when you disagree with something, you know?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: But I don’t really disagree with you here.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Well… Then I guess your eyes are just bad story tellers.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: … Right.

next.name: Michael
next.text: … Oh.

I feared as much.
A bit preachy, innit?
Well I appreciate your opinion.

name: Squid
text: Will you be my friend?

Oh, sure.
Wait, did your Tamagotchi say that?

next.text:
Oh, looks like yours is special.
I have never seen one talking.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
It’s often oddly fitting what he says.
Sometimes I feel like it’s listening.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Well I’m not sure how I feel about that.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Me neither. I wish I could mute it sometimes

next.name: Michael
next.text: Yeah, I can see why.
Alright, but I can’t really become friends with your Tamagotchi...

Unless I become friends with you first.
How does that sound?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Uh… Good.

Man, your voice has an impressive range, Lucas.
Well anyways, glad you want to be my friend.

name: Michael
text:
It looks like we are in the same class.
I’m looking forward to working with you, Lucas.

name: Lucas
text: Working?

name: Michael
text:
Or studying?
Well anyway.
Take care.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]Michael sure is something else.
Which, coming from me…
Well, nevermind that.[/i]

[i]It was awkward, but I’m sure he is a nice guy.
Maybe being different is not too bad after all.
Well but being too different probably is.[/i]

[i]I should master the art of stealthy Tamagotchi interactions.
Using it has become second nature to me, I often don’t even think actively about using it most of the time.[/i]

name: Squid
text: I’m tired.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]My first day at high school went surprisingly well.
I actually was able to make a few conversations.
I guess I have Michael to thank for that.[/i]

[i]Not only did he talk to me a lot, he also tried to include me in almost every conversation he had.
And he had a lot of conversations.[/i]

[i]It seems like it’s really easy for him to talk to people, even if what he says is so…
Different.[/i]
[i]Speaking of the devil.[/i]

name: Michael
text: Yo.

name: Lucas
text: Hey, thanks for helping me out there.

name: Michael
text: What do you mean?

name: Lucas
text:
Ah, you know. Just talking to me.
I barely talked to my classmates in middle school.

name: Michael
text:
Well, that’s their loss.
You don’t need to thank me for talking to you.
I do that because I like it.

Talking about liking things.
What do you like, Lucas?
Except your virtual pet I mean.

name: Lucas
text:
I… like the sea.
It’s vast and mysterious.
It’s vibrant and brimming with life.

name: Michael
text: You are kidding me.

name: Lucas
text: Did I say something wrong?

name: Michael
text:
No, I just mean I love it too.
You know, I want to be a marine biologist.
It feels like there is a whole different world down there.

A world that we usually don’t see.
There is just so much we don’t know.
And we have not even seen the bottom yet.

name: Michael
text: What’s with that frowny face of yours?

name: Lucas
text:
Oh sorry. I didn’t mean to…
Look like this.
It’s just that, my mother disappeared while exploring the deep.
It brings back a lot of memories of her.

But don’t get me wrong, I still love the sea.
And I want to see it with my own eyes.

The things my mother saw.
Maybe I even will find her.

name: Lucas
text:
I know that… She won’t be alive if I found her.
It would be mostly for closure…
I’m sorry, I just met you and here I’m ranting about...

name: Michael
text:
I don’t mind.
You must have been through a lot.

name: Lucas
text: Sorry for bringing the mood down like that.

name: Michael
text:
I really don’t mind.
And like you said, we just met but I want you to know that you can talk to me about that.

Of course, only if you are comfortable with sharing it.
I will listen.
As long as you can also stand listening to me once in a while.

name: Lucas
text: It’s a deal then.

name: Michael
text:
Yeah.
See you tomorrow.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]A month passed and I grew closer to Michael, although he arguably grew closer to everyone else as well.
He shares my passion for the sea.[/i]

[i]Maybe he is even more passionate about it than me.
Once he starts talking about it, no one can really stop him.[/i]

[i]That’s why most people avoid bringing it up in his presence.
It sometimes feels like he is a walking underwater compendium.[/i]
[i]Today that underwater compendium has invaded my house.[/i]

name: Michael
text: Dude, you have your house all for yourself?

name: Lucas
text: Yeah, but my aunt still comes by now and then.

name: Michael
text: Is that legal?

name: Lucas
text: I mean, I don’t see a problem with her coming every few days.

name: Michael
text: No, I mean you living alone at your age.

name: Lucas
text: I… don’t know. But it’s not like I’m struggling.

name: Michael
text:
That’s what you say but I bet you get really lonely all the time.
Maybe I should visit more often?

name: Lucas
text: [i]Michael smirks at me.[/i]
This is the first time you are visiting me.

name: Michael
text: So?

name: Lucas
text: You literally just walked through the door.

name: Michael
text: What are you getting at?

name: Lucas
text: You have not seen my house at all and are already offering to visit more often.

name: Michael
text:
How does your house matter?
It’s not like I’m visiting your house, I’m visiting you.

name: Lucas
text: We see each other essentially every day.

name: Michael
text:
You really are not used to this kind of thing, huh?
You know visiting your friends is normal.
You don’t need a profound reason for it.

Or any other reasons besides wanting to see them more.
You gotta hang out with more people, you will get what I mean.

name: Lucas
text: … Yeah.

name: Michael
text: I don’t wanna talk you into anything but…

name: Lucas
text: But you really do?

name: Michael
text: Yes.

name: Michael
text: Did you ever really talk to someone in our class except myself?

next.text:
Oh don’t be like that.
Some are great, really.
You won’t regret it.

Michael: Now that’s the spirit, Lucas.
I will be there for you when…
Nevermind you got this.

choices.text: I talk to people all the time.

next.text: … No you don’t.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I do.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Can you even name three people in our class?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Michael… Lucas.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Are you doing this on purpose?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
Alright… Uh.
Judith, Marc… Robby?

next.name: Michael
next.text: Who the heck is Robby?

next.name: Michael
next.text: Point being, you don’t

text: Maybe you should try speaking to Sarah.

name: Lucas
text:
I think I know her.
Auburn hair, freckles, cheerful.
She talks to you a lot.

name: Michael
text:
Yeah, that's her. Maybe you are more observant than I gave you credit for.
So you do know a few people?

name: Squid
text: I don’t feel so well.

name: Michael
text: What was that?

name: Lucas
text: My squid said it isn’t feeling so well.

name: Michael
text:
Well that’s not good.
Are you taking proper care of it?
Want my soon to be marine biologist advice on squid care?

name: Lucas
text:
I am… I think.
And I don’t think your advice would apply to a digital Squid.

name: Michael
text:
I admit my knowledge on digital squids is lacking.
Well go on and take care of it.

name: Lucas
text: Oh I did.

name: Michael
text: Really? I didn’t see you doing it.

name: Lucas
text:
I just got really fast at doing it.
Faster than you can see.
In fact I do it all the time without anyone noticing.

name: Michael
text: Even in class?

name: Lucas
text: Even in class.

name: Michael
text: That’s impressive… I think.

name: Lucas
text: But lately it has been acting up despite the fact that all its needs were met.

name: Michael
text: Yeah, normal squids don’t do that.

name: Lucas
text: Haha, well I guess my squid is special.

name: Michael
text:
Yes, like in especially needy.
I think you would have less work with an actual pet squid.

name: Lucas
text: But this one is cuter.

name: Michael
text:
Let’s agree to disagree...
Which is not to say yours isn’t cute.

name: Lucas
text: Okay.

name: Michael
text:
… Hey this might come out of nowhere but…
Do you think we will work together in the future?
I mean our interests align pretty well, don’t you think?
I think we would have great synergy.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
I don’t see it.
That would mean being stuck together with you my whole life, right?

next.name: Michael
next.text:
Well, yes. More or less.
Does the thought terrify you? Don’t wanna commit?
I know, your entire life sounds like a long time, but in the grand scheme of things it’s pretty short.
You know, some sponges and corals get more than a thousand years old.

And a certain specimen of a shark was found to be older than 400 years.
Imagine being stuck with me for that long!

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Haha, I don’t wanna.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Mean.

Well, you are right.
But I’m being serious here.
We would be a good team, iconic.
With my brain and your… and you, we would be unbeatable.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Your brain surely isn’t that impressive.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Sassy today, aren’t we?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I can’t deny it.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
You are right, I feel the synergy overflowing right now.
We will definitely work together in the future.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Yeah, that’s what I’m talking about.

name: Michael
text: It’s settled then.

name: Lucas
text: What is?

name: Michael
text: That we will be a team.

name: Squid
text: Follow your dreams.

name: Michael
text:
See, it agrees.
Too late to resist.

name: Lucas
text: But I didn’t even…]

name: Michael
text:
So, you got any games besides your squid?
Something we could play together?

name: Lucas
text: I… uh.. Yes.

[i]And just like that Michael wrestled control away from me.
Not that I ever was in control with him around.
No, not even in my own house.[/i]
[i]I enjoyed numerous hours of playing and chatting with my assertive friend before I sent him home and went to bed.[/i]

I am…
Where am I?
It’s cold. I can barely see.
It sounds like… I’m underwater?

This is…
The ocean.

[i]It’s so dark. How deep am I?
There is barely any animal here.
Is this the abyssal zone?[/i]

[i]It’s getting even darker.
I am sinking.[/i]
[i]This… is peaceful.[/i]
-ney

name: Lucas
text:
[i]A voice?
It comes from far below.[/i]

Honey...
I am waiting for you down here.
You have to see this…

...
It’s beautiful.

name: Lucas
text: Mom!

[i]...
A dream.[/i]

[i]It feels like I had it before…
Just wait for me Mom.
I will see it with my own eyes.[/i]

name: Squid
text: Good Morning! Did you sleep well?

I don’t know…
Not really.
But I don’t have time to talk to you right now little one.

name: Squid
text: I don’t feel so well.

Hmmm.
Well I got no choice but to take you to a veterinarian then...

Except I can’t.
Wish they had Tamagotchi vets.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]Today Michael has been avoiding me for some reason.
Maybe he is embarrassed about the corny shit he said yesterday.
Or he finally got sick of my attitude.[/i]
[i]Neither is unlikely.[/i]
Yo, Michael…

name: Lucas
text:
[i]Michael gestures towards the class and points on the girl with auburn hair.
In a whispering voice he says.[/i]

name: Michael
text: Talk.
To.
People.
Idiot.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]He didn't need to say the last part.
I sigh and sit down on my chair.[/i]

Maybe later.
You know, when I feel like it.

name: Michael
text:
Come on.
You got nothing to lose.
You promised me yesterday.

name: Lucas
text:
I did no such thing.
Oh, fine! I just gotta talk right?

name: Michael
text:
Be coherent.
Don’t make a fool of yourself.
Best not mention -

name: Lucas
text:
Yeah, yeah. I got this.
You just sit back and look.

name: Michael
text: Go for it, tigershark.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]Does he think that’s cool?
Well best not comment on it.
I’m in no position to criticise his coolness.[/i]
[i]Right now I’m wobbling to Sarah - a complete stranger - like a seasick toddler.[/i]
H-hey.
[i]Smooth start.[/i]

name: Lucas
text:
[i]She turns around to face me.
I must have been close enough to notice her freckles before…
But I never got close enough to her to see how beautiful she was.[/i]

[i]I more or less forgot everything I wanted to say at this exact moment.
Which, admittedly, was not a lot, but it still felt like a significant loss.[/i]

name: Sarah
text:
Lucas, right?
What’s up?

next.name: Sarah
next.text: What about?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
Ah… well.
The weather, maybe?
The world, the sea, the human condition, the duality of man?

next.name: Sarah
next.text: As a principle of mine I don’t debate the human condition with someone I don’t know a lot about.
You know, things can get quite heated if you don’t know who you are really talking to.
But that would still leave us with… the world, the sea and the duality of man.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Nevermind what?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: My, uh…

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Attempt at talking to me?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Yes.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: … You can try again if you want.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
[i]To my surprise she does not look at me in disgust.
She smiles and blushes ever so slightly.[/i]

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Thank you.

name: Squid
text: Give me snuggles!

name: Sarah
text: Excuse me?

name: Lucas
text: [i]Fuck.[/i]

Sorry, that, uh…
Was my Tamagotchi.

name: Sarah
text:
Well that’s a daring Tamagotchi you have there.
Can I see it?

name: Lucas
text: Uhh, sure

name: Sarah
text: Hmmm…

Well that’s a cute squid. I wouldn’t mind giving it snuggles.
That really surprised me though.
I have never seen a talking Tamagotchi.

name: Lucas
text: Sorry, you must think I’m weird for having it.

name: Sarah
text: Why?

name: Lucas
text: Well, because it’s a children’s toy?

name: Sarah
text:
You think so?
It might be digital, but I still think it counts as a pet.
What’s wrong with having a pet?

name: Squid
text: I’m not feeling so well.
Are you taking proper care of your pet?

name: Lucas
text:
I am.
But lately, no matter what I did, it said it felt sick.

name: Sarah
text:
Hmmm…
Maybe it got lonely with only you around.

name: Lucas
text: You think it can?

name: Sarah
text:
Why not? Your’s seems special anyway.
Can I… touch it?

name: Lucas
text: … Go for it.

[i]Sarah reaches out to touch the Tamagotchi.
I hear her press a button.[/i]

name: Sarah
text: Whow!

name: Lucas
text: What is it?

name: Sarah
text: It uh… Sorta turned into an egg?

name: Lucas
text: What?
[i]It sure as hell turned into an egg.[/i]

next.name: Sarah
next.text: I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to transform your squid into an egg.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Few people do.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: I guess so.

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
Please don’t.
I’m sorry… I.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
[i]Sarah looks seriously troubled.
Maybe that joke was a little too much.[/i]
I won’t sue, sorry that was a tasteless joke.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: But I messed up your pet.

choices.text: It never did that with me.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: I’m sorry…

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
Don’t be.
What button did you press?

next.name: Sarah
next.text: I don’t remember.

name: Lucas
text: Well, it’s probably alright.

name: Sarah
text: You think so?

Yeah, it’s not like it has died or anything.
It’s just… Unprecedented.

[i]I say that, but I would lie if I said I wasn’t worried.
It never did anything like that in six years.[/i]

name: Michael
text: Yo, what’s up guys?

name: Sarah
text: I kinda turned his squid into an egg.

name: Michael
text: You what now?

name: Lukas
text: She said she kinda turned my squid into an egg.

name: Michael
text: Yes, I heard that, hence why I asked ‘You what now?’.

name: Lukas
text: [i]I show Michael my Tamagotchi.[/i]

name: Michael
text:
Well, I’ll be damned.
Now I will be extra careful for Sarah not to touch me.
Don’t wanna be turned into an egg…

name: Lukas
text: You should be fine as long as you are not a squid

name: Michael
text: I’m fucked.

name: Sarah
text: You are not a squid, Michael.

name: Michael
text: How do you know?

name: Sarah
text: Now that you mention it… I don’t.

name: Lukas
text: You guys sure get along.

name: Sarah
text: I doubt there is someone who doesn’t get along with Michael.

name: Lukas
text: True. He is awfully sociable for a squid.

name: Michael
text:
You're making me blush…
You guys give me too much credit.

name: Lukas
text:
[i]He is not denying to be squid.
Suspicious.[/i]

name: Michael
text:
Hey, why don’t we meet up at your place tomorrow?
You know, to check up on your squid.

name: Sarah
text:
Yeah, I still feel bad for doing that to it.
Gotta take responsibility for that.
I mean, if that is ok with you?

name: Lukas
text: Uhm… Sure, why not?

[i]I can feel a smug aura emanating from Michael.
He probably thinks he did me a favor there.[/i]

[i]Well, maybe he did.
The more the merrier, right?[/i]

[i]I rush back to my house.
There is not much time until tomorrow.[/i]

[i]Just tidy up a bit…
Vacuum clean the floor…
Clean the windows…[/i]

[i]The bathroom…
Hide a few things…
And clear my browser history.[/i]

[i]Before I realized it, it was past two.
That’s the struggle if you have an entire house for yourself.
Just how did Mom manage to do this on top of her work?[/i]
[i]… Five more min-[/i]

[i]Huh?
I look at the time.
It’s half past ten.[/i]

[i]I’m in my pyjamas.
I have not showered yet, or brushed my teeth, or made myself look like a human being.[/i]

name: Squid
text: It’s time for breakfast.

No time for tha-
What the heck happened to you?!
Oh fuck.

[i]I hastily type a message for Michael explaining my situation.
He says ‘leave it to me!’
I’m concerned, but there is no time for that.[/i]
[i]While I’m breaking the world record for fastest morning routine, I see Sarah and Michael walking through my garden.[/i]
[i]It seems like Michael is giving her a guided tour, which is impressive considering I never gave him one.[/i]

[i]He picks up a garden gnome and moves it through the air…
Maybe imitating an airplane.[/i]

[i]Sarah giggles.
Maybe he got this after all.[/i]
[i]I’m finally done and open the door to the garden.[/i]
Sorry for the holdup guys. You can come in.
[i]Michael hastily puts down the garden gnome.[/i]

name: Michael
text: Don’t mind if we do.

name: Sarah
text: Pardon the intrusion.

name: Michael
text: Damn, it wasn’t nearly as clean when I-

name: Lucas
text: [i]He must have seen the despair in my eyes and quickly shuts up.[/i]

name: Sarah
text:
This place is huge.
You parents must be pretty well off.

name: Michael
text: That uh…

name: Lucas
text: Well they are not around anymore.
[i]Sarah looks like she is ready to die of guilt.[/i]

name: Sarah
text: I’m sorry, I should have…

name: Lucas
text: [i]I smile for her.[/i]

Haha, don’t worry about it, that’s in the past.
I’m just glad you guys came over.
Can I get you anything to drink?

[i]We sit down and talk for a bit.
Michael does his best to lift up the mood.
And he succeeds, as usual.[/i]

name: Sarah
text: So both of you guys want to be marine biologists?

name: Michael
text:
Well, I do.
I think what Lucas wants is a bit different than that.

name: Sarah
text: How so?

name: Lucas
text:
I, uh, more or less want to be a deep sea explorer.
I think Michael would be fine with anything related to the ocean.
I just... want to go down as deep as I can.

name: Sarah
text: Can I ask you a personal question?

name: Lucas
text: Sure. Don’t hold back

name: Sarah
text: Why do you want to be a deep sea explorer when that’s how your mother…

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
For many reasons I think.
But none of them are easy to put into words.
I’m sorry I can’t explain it to you properly.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: I can imagine.

choices.text: I want to see what she saw.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
… She really liked her job.
So much so, that she sometimes would stay away for many many days.

I want to know what made her do a job that required her to stay away from home…
From me.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: That must have been difficult for you…

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
… Yeah.
It was.
But I don’t blame her for doing it.

I know she must have had heer reasons.
And that’s exactly what I want to find out…
What was she looking for down there?
You want to… find her?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
Yeah.
I’m doubting she found the underwater city of myth und decided to stay there…
I mean… I don’t think she…Is alive, you know?

But as things are now, it’s still hard for me to really accept that she is gone.
I’m sorry, I’m not really making sense, am I?
Haha…

next.name: Sarah
next.text: No… I think I know what you mean.

name: Lucas
text:
You know… That Tamagotchi belonged to her.
She gave it to me the day before she left…
It really means a lot to me.
Hehe, that really sounds like the plot of a drama doesn’t it?

name: Michael
text: Well, maybe you are just bigger than life, Lucas.

name: Lucas
text: No way.

name: Sarah
text: Talking about your squid, is it still an egg?

name: Lucas
text: Oh about that, it hatched.

name: Sarah
text: Really? Can I see?

name: Lucas
text: Oh sure.
[i]Michael and Sarah come closer to inspect my reborn squid.[/i]

name: Michael
text:
Damn, it evolved.
Did you level it up?
Maybe Sarah is like a waterstone or something?

name: Sarah
text: Maybe.

name: Lucas
text: It’s like 30% less cute now.

name: Michael
text:
Really?
I think it got even cuter.

name: Sarah
text:
I agree.
What a beauty.

name: Squid
text: I love having a friend like you!

Its voice changed too!
It seems like I made your squid an adult…

name: Lucas
text: … Uhh.

name: Michael
text: Did its needs change?

name: Lucas
text: Not as far as I could tell.

name: Michael
text:
It’s not in sudden needs of alcohol to cope with existing?
Can you really call it an adult then?

name: Sarah
text: Just how bleak is your outlook on adulthood, Michael.

name: Lucas
text:
He says some dark shit sometimes.
I think he is in his edgy phase.

name: Sarah
text: Hehehe.

name: Michael
text: Oh you, got guts making fun of me, Mr_Tamagotchi_Lover.

name: Lucas
text: Huh, what’s that Mr_Edgy_Ocean_Lover?

name: Squid
text: I crave nourishment.

name: Michael
text:
Hear that?
It craves nourishment.
Aren’t you gonna feed it?

name: Lucas
text: … I am. But not because you told me to, you smug prick.
[i]While we were bantering like two idiots, Sarah just watched us and laughed.[/i]
[i]And sometimes she would chime in to add fuel to our conflict, or dealt jabs of her own.[/i]
[i]I think it was there that I fell for her.[/i]

[i]...
It’s really fun… Being with these two.
I think I’m not alone anymore, Mom.[/i]

[i]We had fun fooling and goofing around from then on.
And like this weeks passed, then months then years.[/i]

[i]We three stuck together like seaweed tangled in a net.
Michaels words, not mine.[/i]

[i]Today is the day of our graduation.
Michael graduated on top of our class.[/i]

[i]The teachers repeatedly told him that he could aim for literally anything he wanted to.
That he did not have to be so dead set on becoming a marine biologist.[/i]

[i]But, of course, he already made up his mind.
As did I.[/i]

[i]We would be a team. Or that’s the plan at least.
Sarah on the other hand decided to study in law in a different university than us.[/i]
[i]Still in the same city, but we surely won’t see each other as regularly as before.[/i]

name: Squid
text: A bit of your attention, please?
[i]sigh[/i]

I’m, like, in the middle of an explanation here.
Well, fine…
Sarah asked me to meet up with her before we went our ways.
[i]Hence why I’m here, and she is there.[/i]
Yo, Sarah.

name: Sarah
text: Yo.

name: Lucas
text: Where is Michael?

name: Sarah
text: I dunno. Maybe he is waiting for us at the gate.

name: Lucas
text: Then we should go see him.

name: Sarah
text:
I actually wanted to talk to you.
Just you.

name: Lucas
text: What did that bastard do to you?

name: Sarah
text: Jeez, can’t you be serious for more than 30 seconds?

name: Lucas
text: Sorry, it kinda became a reflex with Michael around.

name: Sarah
text: Haha… I know what you mean.

name: Lucas
text: So what is it you wanted to talk about?
[i]Sarah grows silent, fidgeting ever so slightly.[/i]

name: Sarah
text: I… Uh. I just wanted to let you know that I will miss you.

choices.text: But we won’t stop seeing each other altogether.

next.text:
YYeah, but I mean…
Seeing you as often as this.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Yeah. It will certainly be a lot less than now.
Really?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Yeah. The time we spent together, you and I…

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
And Michael... it is really precious to me.
And I don’t want it to be over.
Let’s meet up as often as we can.
Don’t you… want to say anything?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I’m still thinking about what to say.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Oh… take your time.
[i]What would Michael say now...[/i]

name: Lucas
text:
[i] Sarah starts looking annoyed.
It seems her nervousness disappeared to accommodate her newly found annoyance.[/i]

name: Sarah
text:
You really are the densest element on our planet.
If you so much as set foot into the ocean, I bet you would sink down immediately.
I like [i]you[/i], you idiot.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]It seems Sarah’s wording surprised even herself…
Now she just looks at me expectantly, but also worried…
Most likely because she fears I still do not understand what she said.[/i]

[i]But I do. And I probably even understood before she had to say it to my face.
I really am an idiot…[/i]

name: Squid
text: Never stop chasing your dreams.

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
…
As friends?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
[i]I knew it, she still doesn’t think I know what she means.
Not that I can blame her.[/i]

No… as more than a friend.
… And more than a best friend.
Will you go out with me?

[i]I can see Sarah tear up a bit.
She rushes over to hug me.[/i]

next.name: Sarah
next.text: … Yeah. Let’s.

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
Oh, you don’t have to gi-
… What did you just say?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
[i]Shit, did I jump the gun after all?
I turn around in embarrassment.
Should have figured that it wasn’t about that.[/i]

[i]Haha, what am I saying, I know she doesn’t -
But before I can finish my thought I can feel Sarah hugging me from behind.[/i]

[i]We stand like that for thirty incredibly short seconds before she lets me go.
Her face is reddened and her eyes are wet.[/i]

next.name: Sarah
next.text: I can’t believe you made me wait three years for this.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I’m sorry.

choices.text: You sure you don’t like Michael?

next.name: Sarah
next.text: [i]sigh[/i]

Yes.
And I think he will never like anyone as much as the sea.
Are you sure that [i]you[/i] don’t like Michael?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Well, I [i]do[/i] like Michael.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Oh, for fucks sake.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: But Michael I like as a friend.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
And… I think I like you as more than a friend.
I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have brought Michael up.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Yeah… no kidding.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
[i]Sarah looks at me.
Her face is reddened and her eyes are wet.[/i]
Will you go out with me?

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Yes… you idiot.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Yeah… I really am an idiot.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]She closes her eyes.
And I close mine.
[/i]

name: Lucas
text:
...
So…
Who of us is gonna pilot it?

name: Michael
text: You.

name: Lucas
text:
Well that was quick.
What gives?

name: Michael
text:
I’m not good with cramped places.
I even get anxious in cars.
So, unless they ever conceive a spacious submarine... I’m out.

name: Lucas
text:
And you couldn’t have mentioned that before?
In the what? Eight years we spent together?

name: Michael
text: I’m honestly surprised that you didn’t find out such an important thing in eight years, Lucas.

name: Lucas
text:
But you easily could have brought it up before.
Like when we were driving around in my car.

name: Michael
text:
You couldn’t feel my profound uneasiness when you were driving?
I thought we had some kind of soul bond.

name: Lucas
text:
A soul bond?
Nevermind that, I thought you were just unhappy with my driving skills

name: Michael
text:
That too.
I can’t believe a laid-back guy like you would be such an aggressive driver.

Maybe I should pilot the sub after all.
I don’t want you to kill yourself with reckless deep sea driving maneuvers.

name: Lucas
text:
I won’t pull any stunts.
And there is no traffic deep down there, nothing to get my blood pressure up.
Also, most things down there are smart enough not to mess with a sub.

name: Michael
text:
Yeah, I’m just pulling your leg.
You know, I still can’t believe we really get to use a submarine.

name: Lucas
text: Yeah… It feels like a dream.

name: Squid
text: Never stop chasing your dream.

name: Michael
text:
Maybe I should shift my research to your Tamagotchi.
Sometimes it’s really uncanny how fitting the things it says are.

name: Lucas
text: Well, it must have some words it recognises… Maybe.

name: Michael
text: Why should a Tamagotchi have that?

name: Lucas
text:
Beats me.
Maybe so it can be a better friend for you?
It worked for me.

name: Michael
text:
Yeah, maybe.
So, you wanna check out our office too?

name: Lucas
text:
Yeah.
Although, I gotta admit that I am sceptical.

name: Michael
text: Why?

name: Lucas
text: Because I left the interior design to you of course.

name: Michael
text: Well, make sure to hold on to your socks lest they will be blown off.

name: Lucas
text: A-ha…

name: Michael
text: Ta-dah!!!

name: Lucas
text: I gotta say, it’s more than I expected.

name: Michael
text: You are making me blush.

name: Lucas
text: Is that a harpoon?

name: Michael
text: What does it look like to you?

name: Lucas
text: A harpoon.

name: Michael
text: Exactly.

name: Lucas
text: So… it is a harpoon?

name: Michael
text:
Hm? Oh, no.
No, no, no.
It’s a [i]model[/i] of a harpoon.

name: Lucas
text: So… why do we have a model of a harpoon gun?

name: Michael
text:
What do you mean why?
To liven up the room.
As decoration you know?

name: Lucas
text: Right… That’s what you spent our 3000 bucks budget on?

name: Michael
text: Hm? No.

name: Lucas
text: So… you have money left, right?

name: Michael
text:
Uhhh… No, should I?
I spent most of it on that painting.

name: Lucas
text: You mean that poster?

name: Michael
text:
Same difference.
It was painted by a talented artist, you know?

name: Lucas
text:
I can see that, but did you have to spend…
I think you did a good job.
You know, it’s alright.

You even hung up our diplomas in here.
But may I ask why there only is one chair in here?

name: Michael
text:
I knew you would ask that.
…

name: Lucas
text: So?

name: Michael
text: We were on a budget.

name: Lucas
text: Right.

name: Squid
text: Time to play!

name: Michael
text:
More like time to work.
You know, our fight starts now.

name: Squid
text: Always give it your all!

My, someone is talkative today.
The squid is right, you know?
Let’s prepare for our diving gig next week.
You still have to read the manual for the sub, right?

name: Lucas
text:
Uh-huh… Well… I read most of it already.
Until then, let’s do a bit of freediving… Fieldwork I mean.

name: Michael
text:
Yeah.
By the way, what was your record for holding your breath again?

name: Lucas
text: Uh… Six minutes and a few seconds.

name: Michael
text: Wow, look at you, tough guy.
Wanna make it a competition?

next.text:
Haha.
I’m gonna show you the power of…
My lungs!
But hey, don’t overdo it.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I know. Lets’ go.

Well, that probably is the right decision.
Let’s not overdo it.
Don’t wanna drown my partner after we got this far.

text:
[i]Ah, the water is cold.
Pleasingly cold.
I open my eyes.[/i]

[i]Ah…
That vast blue.
The seaweed sways mildly.[/i]

[i]I don’t move a muscle.
A few meters away from me I see Michael floating elegantly through the water.[/i]

[i]It seems he made friends with an inquisitive eel.
As expected of Micheel…
I hold that thought while I investigate my surroundings.[/i]

[i]Only now I spot the fish that are swimming through the seaweed.
Eating… Sleeping… Hiding…[/i]

[i]I love being here.
It’s so… peaceful.
The only place where Michael isn’t talking non-stop[/i]
[i]Which makes this the only quiet place in the world.[/i]

[i]I close my eyes and enjoy the silence.
I feel myself sinking again. The most peaceful feeling there is.[/i]

[i]I sink…
Deeper.
And deeper.[/i]

[i]…
… -as.
A voice?[/i]

[i]… -cas.
…
… Mom?[/i]

name: Michael
text: Lucas!

name: Lucas
text:
[i] try to take breath but I can’t.
My lungs burn like they are filled to the brim with fire.
I start coughing up water.[/i]

name: Michael
text:
You idiot!
What were you thinking?!
Fuck! Get it all out.

Just like that.
…

Dude… don’t do that to me again.
Fuck…
What would I have told Sarah if…

name: Michael
text: Hey! Stay with me!

name: Lucas
text: [i]He slaps my face a tad too strongly.[/i]

Ouch, fuck!
Hey, I’m with you. Don’t slap me like that.

name: Michael
text:
What do you mean you are with me?
You just called me ‘Mom’ some seconds ago!
You are not with anyone right now.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]I look at Michael, still slightly in a daze.
Michaels eyes are swollen and red.[/i]

next.name: Michael
next.text:
What?
You mean that?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: [i]He points towards his eyes.[/i]

next.name: Michael
next.text:
That’s just a little barotrauma…
But I also must have cried a bit.
Hey, I’m just glad you are fit enough to make cheeky comments again.

next.name: Michael
next.text:
You are welcome…
But you better work your ass off to make up for this.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
Yeah…
I will.

next.name: Michael
next.text: [i]sigh[/i]
I lost sight of you when playing with my eel.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Excuse me?

next.name: Michael
next.text: I played around with an eel and lost sight of you.

next.name: Michael
next.text:
We were already past five minutes, so I dove back up to see if you were there.
But you weren’t.

So I kinda panicked and dove down a bit too quickly.
I found you floating through some seaweed with your mouth open…

As if you were a frogfish waiting for its prey…
But your eyes were open too.

You were already down there for like seven minutes, so I grabbed you and swam up…
Also a bit too quickly.

Hence why my eyes look like this.
Yours do too by the way.

name: Lucas
text: I’m sorry. I must have drifted off.

name: Michael
text: I hope you did not intend that pun.

name: Lucas
text: I didn’t.

name: Michael
text:
You are a rare breed of dumbass to fall asleep underwater.
It’s settled then: no more freediving for you.

name: Lucas
text: Eeeeh?

name: Michael
text:
Don’t ‘eeeeh’ me you idiot.
You almost fucking died.
You are soon to be a father so don’t fucking die.

That’s like the ‘Being a Dad 101’:
‘Don’t die before your child is born.’
‘And best not die before it reached adulthood either.’

name: Lucas
text: Thanks, Michael.

name: Michael
text:
For what?
The advice?
The verbal abuse?

name: Lucas
text:
Those too.
And…
Can we keep it a secret from Sarah?
Are you out of your mind?

name: Lucas
text:
Michael… Please.
I don’t want to worry Sarah with the baby coming.

name: Michael
text: But she should be worried... with a reckless person like you.
… Fine.

But, please, be careful from now on. You owe it to me.
And her…Them.
Deal?

name: Lucas
text: Deal.

name: Michael
text: Well let’s get you back home, shall we?

name: Lucas
text: You are driving me?

name: Michael
text:
What? No.
You know I don’t have a license.

name: Lucas
text: Well then I will-

name: Michael
text:
No, we will take the bus.
You, uh, shouldn’t strain yourself.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]He probably just doesn’t want to be my passenger…
But I guess that’s fine.[/i]

name: Lucas
text: I’m back.

name: Lucas
text:
Hey, babe. How was your day?
Did Michael ‘fuck up the office’?
Yo, Sarah.

name: Sarah
text:
Hey, Michael!
Come in.
And that with fucking up the office came from Lucas, not me.

name: Lucas
text: Way to sell me out, Sarah.

name: Sarah
text:
… Just how do you two look?!
What happened to you?

name: Michael
text:
Ah, you know, the usual.
Minor barotrauma.

name: Sarah
text:
Yes, I can see that.
What I meant is, how did this happen?

name: Michael
text: We went freediving for a bit.

name: Squid
text: Care to play with me for a bit?
Shhh…
Ah yes and I played with my eel.

name: Sarah
text: Sorry, what was that?

name: Michael
text: Why does everyone get hung up on that?

Well, long story short we ran out of air and had to dive up quickly.
So yeah, that’s why we look like we hit a massive blunt.

name: Sarah
text:
You sure you didn’t actually hit a blunt?
You know, to celebrate the deal with the submarine and your office?
I wouldn’t be mad with you.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]Oh, she would. And she would have every right to be.
The truth, of course, is worse than that.[/i]

name: Michael
text: Do we look stoned to you?

name: Sarah
text:
I can’t tell whether or not you're stoned only judging by your behaviour, Michael.
It makes too little of a difference with you to say for sure.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]Michael theatrically grasps for air.
Even after all these years, Michael is Sarah's best friend.[/i]

[i]His eyes show a noticeable shadow of guilt.
Maybe I shouldn’t have made him keep the truth from her.[/i]

name: Michael
text:
The office is fabulous by the way.
Not fucked up at all.

name: Lucas
text: [i]Michael looks at me, expecting me to back up his claim.[/i]

next.text:
[i]A lie for a lie.
Thus is the law of equal exchange.
But I shouldn’t stop here.[/i]

I’m still in awe with Michael’s interior design skills.
The moment I stepped foot into the office, I knew…

next.name: Sarah
next.text: What did you know?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: … That Michael has an overwhelmingly… impressive sense for aesthetics.
Yes, it was like an aesthetic post, nay, even more breathtaking.
It made me wonder whether Michael had actually studied art instead.

next.name: Michael
next.text: You could have just said that when you saw the room.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Don’t make this more complicated, Michael!
I was too overwhelmed when I saw it.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Checks out.

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
But… You were not expecting anything at all.
Or so you told me.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I uh…

next.name: Michael
next.text: Damn, that really hurts, Lucas.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: But I stand corrected!

next.name: Sarah
next.text: So what was it like?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
… Imagine the coolest, hippest office you have ever seen…
Like in one of those hip start-ups where you only have to work as much as you want.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Yeah?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
Now, take that times two in terms of… everything.
And add to that…
A harpoon.

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
A harpoon?
What do you need a harpoon for?

next.name: Michael
next.text:
It’s a model of a harpoon.
A toy harpoon, if you will.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: As decoration?

next.name: Michael
next.text:
Precisely.
See, at least there is someone who understands my artistic vision.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: I wouldn’t go that far.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Right.
[i]Michael stares daggers at me.His eyes scream ‘traitor’.[/i]

next.name: Michael
next.text: But you should see it, it’s made from the wood of-

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Did he think of a desk

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
He did. I was flabbergasted.
That alone makes up for the lack of a second chair.

next.name: Michael
next.text: I knew you would come around.

text:
So… Enough about the office.
How is the baby?

name: Lucas
text:
[i]He looks at Sarah’s pregnant belly.
Sarah sighs but can’t hide a faint smile.[/i]

name: Sarah
text:
You really don’t need to ask every other day.
She is fine, just like me.
I think she will be coming soon.

name: Michael
text:
That’s great.
Well, keep me up to date.

name: Sarah
text: Are you leaving already?

name: Michael
text:
Yeah, I don’t want to impose on you.
I didn’t even announce myself.

name: Sarah
text: You are not imposing on us.

name: Squid
text: Dinnertime!

name: Michael
text:
Well, that reminds me…
I have to prepare dinner for my little lady.

name: Sarah
text:
You would be a great dad, you know?
The way you care for your tortoise is nothing short of impressive.

name: Michael
text:
You think so?
Well I learned from the best.

name: Lucas
text: [i]He gives me a wink and leaves.[/i]

name: Sarah
text: Did something happen with Michael?

name: Lucas
text: What do you mean?

name: Sarah
text:
I don’t know, call it a hunch.
He talked way less right now.
Like he was feeling bad for something.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
[i]This is going to be difficult.
But I shouldn’t take Sarah’s perceptiveness lightly.
And… She deserves to know.[/i]

I… I had an accident while diving.
If it hadn’t been for Michael…
I would be -

[i]Sarah hugs me gently and waits for me to calm down.
Didn’t think I would be the one breaking down.[/i]
[i]I'm pathetic.[/i]

next.name: Sarah
next.text: You are not pathetic, you know?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I didn’t say anything…

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
You didn’t need to.
It’s alright.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I’m so sorry.

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
I know.
Just…

Don’t do that to me again.
Please be careful… and value your own life.
I need you.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
[i]She takes my hand and places it on her belly.
I feel her warmth… and the gentle kicks of tiny feet.[/i]

next.name: Sarah
next.text: She needs you.
… Yeah

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Let’s go to bed, ok?

choices.text: He felt a bit queasy from diving.

next.text:
Oh, he normally doesn’t…
Usually he is even more energetic afterwards.

Has it something to do with his ‘eel’ he mentioned?
Potency problems maybe?

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
I uh…
Wouldn’t know…

next.name: Sarah
next.text: You guys don’t talk about this kinda thing?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Not with Michael I don’t.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Then with whom do you talk about this kind of thing?

next.name: Lucas
next.text: You…?

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
So Michael doesn’t have anyone to talk about this kind of thing?
Maybe I should talk about it with him.

next.name: Lucas
next.text:
I’m sure his ‘eel’ is fine.
I think you can spare him from that talk.

I… Uh. Can ask about the well-being of his little Micheel.
If you insist.

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
I will think about it.
For now, let’s go to bed.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: Maybe he was upset about what I said about our office.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: I thought you liked it.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: It was passable.

next.name: Sarah
next.text: Hm, it’s not like Michael to dwell on things like that.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: You are right.

next.name: Sarah
next.text:
…
Well, let’s go to bed for today, okay?

name: Lucas
text: Yeah...

name: Lucas
text:
[i]This sensation…
Am I diving again?[/i]

name: Squid
text: That's right.

name: Squid
text: You are dreaming.

name: Squid
text: Dreaming of diving.
I… almost died today.

name: Squid
text: Yeah. That wasn’t good.
No shit.

name: Squid
text: Don’t waste your life like that.

name: Squid
text: Don’t you want to see [i]her[/i]?
… I do.

name: Squid
text: Then hold on to your life.

name: Squid
text: And find her, deep down below.
[i]Am I rising?[/i]

name: Squid
text: You are waking up, Lucas.

next.name: Squid
next.text: [i]sigh[/i]

next.name: Squid
next.text: What good does lingering here do?

next.name: Squid
next.text: Are you buying time?
No...

next.name: Squid
next.text: Did you come to loathe the sea?

No…
I just feel like I should be awake.
And not here.

next.name: Squid
next.text: Well then…

next.name: Squid
next.text: You will find her soon enough.

next.name: Squid
next.text: I hope.
You hope?

next.name: Squid
next.text: I’m a dream squid, not a medium.

next.name: Squid
next.text: Now…

name: Rise and shine, squiddo.
text: Squid

name: Squid
text: And, goodbye.

name: Lucas
text: ...Hmm.

name: Sarah
text: What’s up, babe?

name: Lucas
text: The squid did that thing again.

name: Sarah
text: That thing?

name: Lucas
text: You know, what happened six years ago?

name: Sarah
text: What do you mean? I’m still half asleep…

name: Lucas
text: It’s back to being an egg.

name: Sarah
text: Oh. Well I don’t remember touching it…

name: Lucas
text: It might be his final evolution…

name: Sarah
text: Or it goes back to it’s baby form.

name: Lucas
text: Maybe. Time will tell.

name: Sarah
text: Enough about the squid, you need to go to work.
Damn, you are right.

name: Michael
text:
Where have you been?
Mr. Lawrence just came by.

name: Lucas
text: What did he say?

name: Michael
text: That we will do our test dive today.

name: Lucas
text: You are kidding.

name: Michael
text: I’m not. You read the manual?

name: Lucas
text: Yeah…

name: Michael
text:
I don’t like the sound of that but you can wing it.
Probably.

name: Lucas
text: I think I got this.

name: Michael
text: We will be going… 4000 Meters deep.

name: Lucas
text: In what world is that a test run?

name: Michael
text:
Believe it or not: in yours…
How are your lungs?

name: Lucas
text: They are fine.

name: Michael
text:
Good.
Don’t worry, I will be with you.

name: Lucas
text: Thank god, I think I would panic if I had to pilot that thing alone today.

name: Lucas
text: What?

name: Michael
text:
You have to pilot that thing alone today, Lucas.
It’s a one-person submarine.
You know that.
I mean I will be there to talk with you, over radio.

name: Lucas
text: Fantastic.

name: Michael
text:
Divers can’t be choosers.
Now get in the fucking sub, Lucas.

name: Lucas
text: Alright, alright. No need to push me.

name: Michael
text:
Sorry, I don’t know why I worded it like that.
Well anyways, get to business.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]I jump into the submarine.
It’s about as cramped in here as economy class on a discount airline.[/i]
[i]… Maybe even worse.[/i]
[i]I’m not a claustrophobic like Michael, but I still don’t exactly feel comfortable.[/i]

name: Michael
text: We will let you in now, buckle up.

name: Lucas
text: Ok, just give me a count-

name: Lucas
text: Down.

name: Michael
text: See anything?

name: Lucas
text:
How could I not see anything?
There is a literal window in front of me.

name: Michael
text:
Alright.
... Hm? ...

name: Lucas
text:
[i]I handle the interface as best as I can.
And sure enough I start going down.[/i]

[i]The engine is humming quietly.
I enjoy the views around me as I go deeper and deeper.
Until I stop recognizing most of the animals and plants.[/i]

name: Michael
text:
Wow...
I wish I was sitting in your seat right now.
And at the same time I’m also happy sitting here and not [i]there[/i].

name: Lucas
text: Maybe you can try it one day.

The window kinda gives the impression of an open space.
It’s more like panoramic scuba diving.

name: Mr. Lawrence
text: Please stop your idle chit-chat, gentlemen.

name: Michael
text: Oh, sure…

name: Lucas
text: [i]Grumpy son of gun…[/i]
[i]But maybe a bit of quiet is nice too.[/i]
[i]I accelerate my descent.[/i]
[i]And go down.[/i]
[i]Slowly the light starts fading.[/i]

[i]I turn the headlights to maximum brightness.
To no avail.[/i]

[i]They illuminate maybe the first 30 meters in front of me.
And I don’t see anything but floating particles and dark.[/i]
[i]I can’t see the ground.[/i]

[i]I stop the sub and turn it around.
But I still can’t see the ground.
Just when did I lose sight of it[/i]
Michael?

name: Lucas
text: Michael?
… Fuck.
[i]I’m starting to feel kind of tense.[/i]
[i]Seeing absolutely nothing after turning the lights on is a scary sensation.[/i]

[i]I lean back and sigh.
Is that what Mom saw?[/i]

[i]Darkness?
Devoid of life and meaning?[/i]

name: Lucas
text: Hm?

name: Squid
text: Heyo, Squiddo.

name: Lucas
text: Whoa… When did you?
Hm… No more pets?

name: Squid
text: Care to help an old squid?

name: Lucas
text: Hmmm… You need…

name: Lucas
text: Medicine now?

name: Lucas
text: Well, alright, I guess.

name: Michael
text: Lucas?

name: Lucas
text: Michael?

name: Michael
text:
Oh, you are back.
Don’t scare me like that.
I thought I lost you… Again.

name: Lucas
text: I called for you but you didn’t respond.

name: Michael
text: Weird…

name: Lucas
text:
Well anyway, can you help me orientate?
I kinda lost sight of the ground and I’m in a bit of pickle here.

name: Michael
text:
Well figures, I mean you went beyond the continental shelf.
And the continental slope is steep.
Are you sure you have a Master of Science in marine biology?

name: Lucas
text: Sh- shut up.

It feels different in here, kinda lost my focus.
There is no textbook that prepares you for… That.

name: Michael
text: Oh, you mean that absolute, all encompassing darkness?

name: Lucas
text: Yes, that.

And being stuck in a room the size of an airplane toilet.
It’s starting to smell like one too.
For the first time in a while I was happy to hear your voice.

name: Michael
text: Charming.

name: Squid
text: Hm, I’m quite hungry…

name: Michael
text: Wait, did you take your squid with you?

name: Lucas
text:
Yeah, I did.
It’s old and wrinkly now.

name: Michael
text: Happens to the best of us.

Oh!
Continue your descent, please. We are not quite there yet.

name: Lucas
text: Gotcha.

Wait stop!
Did you see that?

name: Michael
text: I think I saw an anglerfish.

Oh, man.
I’ll just have to review the video recordings.
Next time please stop if you see something.

name: Lucas
text: But I didn’t see it.

name: Michael
text: Well then stop if I tell you to stop.
Ok, we should shortly be reaching the abyssal plane.

Wait, stop your engine.
That is…
Dear god…

name: Lucas
text:
[i]Below me I see a gargantuan shadow moving.
It’s swimming very slowly towards the surface…[/i]
[i]In my direction.[/i]

name: Michael
text: Quick, turn off your lights.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]I do as Michael says.
And I immediately see why he told me to.[/i]

[i]The creature is bioluminescent.
I watch in awe as it swims by, barely more than 20 meters away from the sub.[/i]
[i]Once it’s gone I hear Michael scream in ecstasy.[/i]

name: Michael
text: What the heck?

What the heck, man?!
That was awesome!

I never saw anything like that.
We might have just made the discovery of a century.
A bioluminescent whale?!

next.name: Michael
next.text: Woooh… That really got my blood pumping.

next.name: Michael
next.text: Eeeeh? I don’t wanna.

But I want that whale to be famous.
I already decided on a name for it.

next.name: Lucas
next.text: I’m not sure I want to hear it.

next.name: Michael
next.text: ‘Shining Michael’

Although shining would be inaccurate.
But ‘Bioluminescent Michael’ lacks that certain ring…

next.name: Lucas
next.text: So you wanna be famous after all?

next.name: Michael
next.text: What? No...

next.name: Michael
next.text:
I don’t know.
It resembled one in form and voice.
Well let’s not jump the gun here, it could be anything, really.

name: Michael
text:
That thing... It was probably more than 50 meters long.
That’s crazy… For something so big living down here.

Well if it’s a whale it must go up to breath from time to time.
How come we never saw such a big whale on the surface before?

How mysterios.
Well, I will have to review that footage…

For the next three years of my life.
But maybe you will find even more crazy things down there.

name: Squid
text: Never stop going forward!

name: Michael
text: That’s gotta be a sign.
Oh hold on, Mr. Grumpy is coming back.

name: Mr. Lawrence
text:
I saw the video feed.
That was nothing short of amazing…
To think that you would discover a new species of such proportions on a test run.
It seems like you were the right candidates for this kind of mission.

name: Michael
text: Thanks, Mr. Lawrence.

name: Mr. Lawrence
text: Do you think you can keep going?

name: Lucas
text: Sir?

name: Mr. Lawrence
text:
I mean down the trench.
Where the creature came from.
The submarine should be able to withstand the pressure of 11000 meters depths or even more.

name: Michael
text: Sir, I don’t think that’s a good idea.

name: Lucas
text: It’s okay Michael, I will go. Mom would have done the same.

name: Michael
text: Lucas…
But what-

name: Mr. Lawrence
text: He said he is gonna do it.

name: Lucas
text: Michael, I got this…

name: Lucas
text: [i]I look down into the unknown.[/i]

name: Lucas
text: [i]And I feel… something.[/i]

name: Lucas
text:
[i]It must be what Mom felt.
It’s like a mix of fascination and dread.
It draws me in and doesn’t let me go.[/i]

name: Michael
text: Lucas your ox-

name: Lucas
text: [i]The radio?[/i]
[i]I’m already… below 8000 meters.[/i]
Michael? Mr. Lawrence?

name: Lucas
text: [i]I have come too far down to go back now.[/i]

[i]I can feel her…
She is close.[/i]
[i]She must be.[/i]

name: Squid
text: You are close, Lucas.

name: Lucas
text: [i]Mom? Are you really waiting there for me?[/i]

name: Squid
text: She is.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]I can finally see a stretch of ground beneath me.
The headlights of the sub barely illuminate anything with their range.[/i]

name: Lucas
text: [i]Just how deep did I go?[/i]

name: Squid
text: About 13.000 meters.

name: Lucas
text:
[i]That’s impossible.
Am I dreaming again?[/i]

name: Lucas
text: [i]I search the ground for… Anything.[/i]
[i]For her.[/i]
[i]Buried, within the mud I recognise the outline of a submarine… And another one.[/i]

[i]I frantically search the area for more.
There is no end to them.[/i]

[i]That doesn’t make sense.
There are too many of them.[/i]

[i]Suddenly, I see it: a tiny scientific submarine.
The one I saw in pictures.[/i]
[i]Pictures my mother showed me when she was boasting about piloting her own submarine.[/i]
[i]A sudden flood of emotion washed over me and the first time since my mother's disappearance I cried for her.[/i]

[i]But it was not only grief I felt.
I also felt...[/i]
[i]Relief.[/i]

[i]That my search was not for nothing.
That I had found her.
And that my lifelong ambition was finally fulfilled.[/i]
[i]I had served my purpose.[/i]

name: Squid
text: Not yet, Lucas.

name: Lucas
text: What do you mean?

name: Squid
text: You have one final purpose.

name: Lucas
text: [i]A sudden chill goes down my spine.[/i]

[i]Something on the ground changed.
Something moved. Stirred.
Something that has been down here forever.[/i]

[i]Covered in mud and ancient sediments…
I see it…
I see it now, the thing that you saw.[/i]

[i]It’s beautiful.
Like you said, Mom.[/i]

name: Squid
text: Feed me. One last time.

name: Lucas
text: My last purpose…
